content:
Once https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92306 is merged, all higher-ranked lifetimes errors under NLL should be on par with the current stable output without NLL (e.g. no more "higher-ranked subtype error" errors)

As far I can tell, the last major issue blocking enabling full NLL (turning off migration mode) involves the leak check (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/58781#issuecomment-933606424), though I'm not really clear on what this entails.

Is there anything I can do to help move this along? Is there more design work that needs to be done, or is this "just" a matter of making some needed changes?

cc @nikomatsakis
Are there any additional changes that need to be done since Niko made the most recent leak check refactoring
I assume so, since his comment comes after his changes
